column4: U.S. sets first curbs on power plant carbon emissions

column5: Sept 20 AT&T Inc said on Friday it is exploring options to "monetize" its wireless broadcast towers but noted that its ability to reach a deal would depend on terms it is able to reach with the buyer for long-term operation of the towers.

column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 20 The U.S. House of Representatives on Friday approved an extension of a law allowing farmers to keep growing a genetically modified crop while it is being challenged in court  a move critics said overrode actions to prevent contamination of non-GMO crops.

column4: CORRECTED-BRIEF-NGL Energy Partners to offer 4.1 mln common units (Sept. 19)
column5: (Corrects third bullet to say underwriters will have an option to purchase additional units) Sept 19 NGL Energy Partners LP :  * Announces public offering of common units  * Says offering 4.1 million common units  * Says to use proceeds from the public offering  including underwriters' option to purchase additional common units  to repay debt incurred in connection with recent acquisitions  * Source text for Eikon   * Further company coverage

column4: Nielsen wins U.S. OK for Arbitron deal  with conditions
column5: WASHINGTON Television ratings giant Nielsen Holdings NV won U.S. antitrust approval on Friday for a $1.6 billion deal to buy Arbitron Inc  a company that dominates radio ratings measurement.

column4: UPDATE 2-Nielsen wins U.S. OK for Arbitron deal  with conditions
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 20 Television ratings giant Nielsen Holdings NV won U.S. antitrust approval on Friday for a $1.6 billion deal to buy Arbitron Inc  a company that dominates radio ratings measurement.

column4: Nielsen wins U.S. approval for Arbitron deal  with conditions
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 20 Television ratings giant Nielsen Holdings NV won U.S. antitrust approval on Friday to buy Arbitron Inc  a company which dominates radio ratings measurement.

column4: European agency recommends Novo hemophilia drug for approval
column5: COPENHAGEN Danish insulin maker Novo Nordisk has received a recommendation for marketing approval from a European Medicines Agency (EMA) committee for its hemophilia treatment turoctocog alfa.

column4: NORDIC STOCKS - Factors to watch on Sept 20
column5: HELSINKI  Sept 20 The following stocks may be affected by newspaper reports and other factors on Friday:

column4: UPDATE 2-Sailing-A win and a gift keep Oracle alive in America's Cup
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Sept 20 Oracle Team USA again staved off elimination in the America's Cup on Friday  catching a huge break when the day's first race was abandoned for exceeding the time limit with Emirates Team New Zealand far ahead  and then coming back to win a second race in stronger breezes.

column4: Sailing-Oracle wins another America's Cup race  cuts N. Zealand lead
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Sept 20 Oracle Team USA won race 13 of the America's Cup finals by 1 minute 24 seconds on Friday  narrowing the gap with Emirates Team New Zealand  which now leads the series eight to three and needs just one win to take the cup away from the defender.

column4: U.S. eyes co-development of anti-tank missile with India
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 19 U.S. Deputy Defense Secretary Ashton Carter this week proposed ways to deepen defense ties between the United States and India  including co-development of the next version of the Javelin anti-tank missile now built by Raytheon Co and Lockheed Martin Corp.

column4: Rite Aid CDS at tightest level since 2004
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 20 (IFR) - Rite Aid Corp's credit default swaps (CDS) spreads are at their tightest level since at least 2004 this week as the US drug store chain announced an unexpected quarterly profit and lifted its 2014 guidance.

column4: Rockwell Collins forecasts 2014 profit below estimates
column5: Aviation electronics systems supplier Rockwell Collins Inc  forecast lower-than-expected earnings for 2014  citing federal government budget cuts and declining business jet revenue  and its shares fell about 5 percent.

column4: Fitch Affirms The Royal Bank of Scotland's Mortgage Covered Bonds at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) LONDON  September 20 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed The Royal Bank of  Scotland's (RBS  A/Stable/F1) covered bonds at 'AAA' with a Stable Outlook. KEY RATING DRIVERS The covered bond rating is based on RBS's Long-term Issuer Default Rating (IDR)  of 'A'  a Discontinuity Cap (D-Cap) of 4 (moderate risk) and the asset  percentage (AP) between the covered bonds and the cover pool. The agency takes  into account the highest observed nom

column4: Corsair front runner in RBS branch sale: sources
column5: LONDON A consortium led by private equity firm Corsair has emerged as the front runner to buy 315 branches being sold by Royal Bank of Scotland   three sources with knowledge of the deal told Reuters.

column4: RBS raises 630 million pounds in Direct Line share sale
column5: LONDON State-backed Royal Bank of Scotland  said on Friday it raised 630 million pounds ($1 billion) by selling a 20 percent stake in Direct Line   the latest stage in an EU-ordered disposal of Britain's biggest motor insurer.

column4: UPDATE 1-RBS raises 630 mln stg in Direct Line share sale
column5: * RBS says on track to sell all Direct Line shares by end-2014

column4: RBS raises 630 mln stg through Direct Line share sale
column5: LONDON  Sept 20 State-backed Royal Bank of Scotland said on Friday it had raised 630 million pounds ($1 billion) through the sale of 300 million shares in motor insurer Direct Line at 210 pence a share.

column4: Special Report: How a German tech giant trims its U.S. tax bill
column5: LONDON In July 2012  then-U.S. Treasury Secretary Tim Geithner traveled to an island off the German coast to meet Wolfgang Schaeuble  Germany's finance minister. Schaeuble was on vacation  but Geithner visited to discuss the euro zone crisis. Talk also turned to a long-running bugbear of Schaeuble's: corporate tax avoidance.

column5: OSLO  Sept 20 Seadrill Ltd :  * announces proposed offering of US$500 million of unsecured

column4: Third Point to put Sony shares under own name - Nikkei
column5: Sept 21 Activist investor Daniel Loeb's Third Point LLC will re-register a chunk of its shares in Sony Corp  under its own name  allowing the hedge fund group to file shareholder resolutions and take other steps to push for better management  the Nikkei reported  quoting people familiar with the matter.

column4: Tata Motors plans to raise prices by up to 1.5 pct
column5: MUMBAI  Sept 20 Tata Motors Ltd  India's largest automaker by revenue  is looking to raise prices by 1 percent-1.5 percent across its range of commercial and passenger vehicles  following similar moves by rival carmakers.

column4: Blackstone's Equity Office buys Hughes Center in Las Vegas
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 20 Equity Office Properties  a subsidiary of Blackstone Group LP  on Friday said it bought Hughes Center  a portfolio of 10 office buildings  in Las Vegas for $347 million.

column4: Vornado sells entire J.C. Penney stake for $13 per share
column5: Vornado Realty Trust  has sold its 13.4 million shares in J.C. Penney Co Inc  for $13 a share  ending a three-year investment in the struggling department store operator it had pushed to renew itself.
